posts.post_content:
Through an annoyingly long process of improbable card acquirement, you have procured a long combo with somehow large reliability. It is as follows  
[Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn) + [Paradise Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradise Mantle) + [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds) + [Coretapper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coretapper) + This  
  
A 5 card combo for infinite charge counters/self draw.  
  
[Fate Transfer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fate Transfer) + [Darksteel Reactor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Reactor)  
[March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines)  
  
It's important to note that this would not be a leading card for stuff, if anything, it'd be like a side card that it wouldn't hurt too bad to draw. I can only give it 2.5/5 though.  
See also: [Culling Dais](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling Dais), [Serum Tank](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serum Tank)
posts.html:
Through an annoyingly long process of improbable card acquirement, you have procured a long combo with somehow large reliability. It is as follows
Gilder Bairn + Paradise Mantle + Training Grounds + Coretapper + This

A 5 card combo for infinite charge counters/self draw.

Fate Transfer + Darksteel Reactor
March of the Machines

It's important to note that this would not be a leading card for stuff, if anything, it'd be like a side card that it wouldn't hurt too bad to draw. I can only give it 2.5/5 though.
See also: Culling Dais, Serum Tank

posts.post_content:
This is so bad, it doesn't NEED [Skullclamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skullclamp) in the same block to look horrible. Although. . . there it is.  
  
If you want to sacrifice anything and get cards, use [Culling Dais](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling Dais). You can fill your deck with [Threaten](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Threaten)-type cards, and just turn opponent's creatures into card draw.
posts.html:
This is so bad, it doesn't NEED Skullclamp in the same block to look horrible. Although. . . there it is.

If you want to sacrifice anything and get cards, use Culling Dais. You can fill your deck with Threaten-type cards, and just turn opponent's creatures into card draw.
